Parameters.Name: cancelPreapprovalRequest
Parameters.Description:
Cancels an existing preapproval. 
						A preapproval can be canceled regardless of its state (active, expired, deactivated, previously canceled). 
						Specify which preapproval to cancel using a preapproval key.

Members.Name: preapprovalKey
Members.Description: The preapproval key that identifies the preapproval to be canceled.

Members.Name: requestEnvelope
Members.Description: Information common to each API operation, such as the language in which an error message is returned.

Members.Name: errorLanguage
Members.Description:
Contains the RFC 3066 identifier of the language in which error messages 
								are returned. The only supported option, and the default, is en_US (US English).

Members.Name: detailLevel
Members.Description:
The detail level is the amount of data to return in the call response.
								The default detail level is ReturnAll, which
								specifies that the call response 
								should contain the maximum data available.

Parameters.Name: convertCurrencyRequest
Parameters.Description:
Retrieves an estimated current foreign exchange (FX) rate for a specific amount and currency. This estimated rate may differ from the FX rate used at the time of the transaction. 
						This call does not affect a PayPal balance. Instead, it enables your application to get  estimated exchange rates.

Members.Name: requestEnvelope
Members.Description: Information common to each API operation, such as the language in which an error message is returned

Members.Name: errorLanguage
Members.Description:
Contains the RFC 3066 identifier of the language in which error messages 
								are returned. The only supported option, and the default, is en_US (US English).

Members.Name: detailLevel
Members.Description:
The detail level is the amount of data to return in the call response.
								The default detail level is ReturnAll, which
								specifies that the call response 
								should contain the maximum data available.

Members.Description: A list of amounts with associated currencies to be converted.

The currency code. Allowable values are:
  • Australian Dollar - AUD
  • Brazilian Real - BRL Note: The Real is supported as a payment currency and currency balance only for Brazilian PayPal accounts.
  • Canadian Dollar - CAD
  • Czech Koruna - CZK
  • Danish Krone - DKK
  • EUR - Euro
  • Hong Kong Dollar - HKD
  • Hungarian Forint - HUF
  • Israeli New Sheqel - ILS
  • Japanese Yen - JPY

  • U.S. Dollar - USD

Members.Name: countryCode
Members.Description:
[WSDL] The two-character ISO country code where fx suppposed to happen

[DITA] The two-character ISO code for the country where the function is supposed to happen. The default value is US.

Members.Name: conversionType
Members.Description: The conversion type allows you to determine the converted amounts for a PayPal user in different currency conversion scenarios, e.g., sending a payment in a different currency than what this user holds, accepting payment in a different currency than what the user holds, or converting a balance to a different currency than the user holds.. The default value is SENDER_SIDE.

Parameters.Name: executePaymentRequest
Parameters.Description:
Executes a payment that previously was set up with a Pay API call. 
						 In the ExecutePayment API call, you specify the pay key 
						 that you previously received in a Pay call response.

Members.Name: payKey
Members.Description: The pay key that identifies the payment to be executed. This is the pay key returned in the PayResponse message.

Members.Name: requestEnvelope
Members.Description: Information common to each API operation, such as the language in which an error message is returned.

Members.Description:
The detail level is the amount of data to return in the call response.
								The default detail level is ReturnAll, which
								specifies that the call response 
								should contain the maximum data available.

Members.Name: actionType
Members.Description:
Describes the action that is performed
								by this API

Members.Name: fundingPlanId

Parameters.Name: paymentDetailsRequest
Parameters.Description:
Retrieves information about a payment. 
						You can identify the payment by a tracking ID, 
						by a PayPal transaction ID (e.g. from an IPN message), or 
						by a pay key.

Members.Name: requestEnvelope
Members.Description: Information common to each API operation, such as the language in which an error message is returned.

Members.Name: errorLanguage
Members.Description:
Contains the RFC 3066 identifier of the language in which error messages 
								are returned. The only supported option, and the default, is en_US (US English).

Members.Name: detailLevel
Members.Description:
The detail level is the amount of data to return in the call response.
								The default detail level is ReturnAll, which
								specifies that the call response 
								should contain the maximum data available.

Members.Name: payKey
Members.Description: The pay key that identifies the payment for which you want to retrieve details. This is the pay key returned in the PayResponse message.

Members.Name: transactionId
Members.Description: The PayPal transaction ID associated with the payment. The IPN message associated with the payment contains the transaction ID.

Members.Name: trackingId
Members.Description:
The tracking ID that was specified for this payment in the PayRequest message.

Maximum length: 127 characters

Parameters.Name: payRequest
Parameters.Description:
Transfers funds from a sender's PayPal account to one or more receivers' PayPal accounts.
						You can use this call to make simple payments, chained payments, or parallel payments. 
						The payments can be explicitly approved, preapproved, or implicitly approved.
						Thus, the required fields vary based on whether the payment is a simple, parallel, chained, 
						implicit, or preapproved payment.

Members.Name: actionType
Members.Description:
Whether the Pay request pays the receiver or whether the Pay request is set up to create a payment request, but not fulfill the payment until the ExecutePayment is called.

Allowable values are:
  • PAY - Use this option if you are not using the Pay request in combination with ExecutePayment.
  • CREATE - Use this option to set up the payment instructions with SetPaymentOptions and then execute the payment at a later time with the ExecutePayment.
  • PAY_PRIMARY - For chained payments only, specify this value to delay payments to the secondary receivers; only the payment to the primary receiver is processed.

Members.Name: cancelUrl
Members.Description:
The URL to which the sender's browser is redirected if the sender cancels the approval for the payment after logging in to paypal.com to approve the payment. Specify the URL with the HTTP or HTTPS.

Maximum length: 1024 characters

Members.Name: currencyCode
Members.Description:
The currency code. Allowable values are:
  • Australian Dollar - AUD
  • Brazilian Real - BRL Note: The Real is supported as a payment currency and currency balance only for Brazilian PayPal accounts.
  • Canadian Dollar - CAD
  • Czech Koruna - CZK
  • Danish Krone - DKK
  • EUR - Euro
  • Hong Kong Dollar - HKD
  • Hungarian Forint - HUF
  • Israeli New Sheqel - ILS
  • Japanese Yen - JPY
  • Malaysian Ringgit - MYR Note: The Ringgit is supported as a payment currency and currency balance only for Malaysian PayPal accounts.
  • Mexican Peso - MXN
  • Norwegian Krone - NOK
  • New Zealand Dollar - NZD
  • Philippine Peso - PHP
  • Polish Zloty - PLN
  • Pound Sterling - GBP
  • Singapore Dollar - SGD
  • Swedish Krona - SEK
  • Swiss Franc - CHF
  • Taiwan New Dollar - TWD
  • Thai Baht - THB
  • Turkish Lira - TRY Note: The Turkish Lira is supported as a payment currency and currency balance only for Turkish PayPal accounts.
  • U.S. Dollar - USD

Members.Name: returnUrl
Members.Description:
The URL to which the sender's browser is redirected after approving a payment on paypal.com. Specify the URL with the HTTP or HTTPS designator.

Maximum length: 1024 characters

Members.Name: requestEnvelope
errorLanguage
Members.Description:
Contains the RFC 3066 identifier of the language in which error messages 
								are returned. The only supported option, and the default, is en_US (US English).

Members.Name: detailLevel
Members.Description:
The detail level is the amount of data to return in the call response.
								The default detail level is ReturnAll, which
								specifies that the call response 
								should contain the maximum data available.

Members.Name: receiverList
Members.Description: Information about the receivers of the payment.

Members.Name: receiver
Members.Description: Receiver is the party whose account is credited.

Members.Name: amount
Members.Description: Amount to be paid to the receiver.

Members.Name: email
Members.Description:
Receiver's email address. This address can be unregistered with paypal.com. If so, a receiver cannot claim the payment until a PayPal account is linked to the email address. The PayRequest must pass either an email address or a phone number.

Maximum length: 127 characters

Members.Name: primary
Members.Description:
Whether this receiver is the primary receiver. If this field is set to true, this is a chained payment. If this field shows false, this is a simple or parallel payment.

Possible values are:
  • true - Primary receiver (chained payment)
  • false - Secondary receiver (simple/parallel payment)

Members.Name: invoiceId
Members.Description:
The invoice number for the payment. This data in this field shows on the Transaction Details report.

Maximum length: 127 characters

Members.Name: paymentType
Members.Description:
The transaction type for the payment.

Allowable values are:
  • GOODS - This is a payment for non-digital goods
  • SERVICE - This is a payment for services (default)
  • PERSONAL - This is a person-to-person payment
  • CASHADVANCE - This is a person-to-person payment for a cash advance
  • DIGITALGOODS - This is a payment for digital goods
    • BANK_MANAGED_WITHDRAWAL - This is a person-to-person payment for bank withdrawals, available only with special permission.
Note: Person-to-person payments are valid only for parallel payments that have the feesPayer field set to EACHRECEIVER or SENDER.

Members.Name: paymentSubType
Members.Description: The transaction subtype for the payment.

Members.Name: phone
Members.Description: The receiver's phone number.

Members.Name: countryCode
Members.Description: Telephone country code.

Members.Name: phoneNumber
Members.Description: Telephone number.

Members.Name: extension
Members.Description: Telephone extension.

Members.Name: feesPayer
Members.Description:
The payer of PayPal fees. Allowable values are:
  • SENDER - Sender pays all fees (for personal, implicit simple/parallel payments; do not use for chained or unilateral payments)
  • PRIMARYRECEIVER - Primary receiver pays all fees (chained payments only)
  • EACHRECEIVER - Each receiver pays their own fee (default, personal and unilateral payments)
  • SECONDARYONLY - Secondary receivers pay all fees (use only for chained payments with one secondary receiver)

Members.Name: ipnNotificationUrl
Members.Description:
The URL to which you want all IPN messages for this payment to be sent.

Maximum length: 1024 characters

Members.Name: memo
Members.Description:
A note associated with the payment (text, not HTML).

Maximum length: 1000 characters, including newline characters

Members.Name: pin
Members.Description: The sender's personal identification number, which was specified when the sender signed up for a preapproval.

Members.Name: preapprovalKey
Members.Description: The key associated with a preapproval for this payment. The preapproval key is required if this is a preapproved payment. Note: The Preapproval API is unavailable to API callers with Standard permission levels.

Members.Name: reverseAllParallelPaymentsOnError
Members.Description:
Whether to reverse parallel payments if an error occurs with a payment.

Allowable values are:
  • true - Each parallel payment is reversed if an error occurs
  • false - Only incomplete payments are reversed (default)

Members.Name: senderEmail
Members.Description:
Sender's email address.

Maximum length: 127 characters

Members.Name: trackingId
Members.Description: A unique ID that you specify to track the payment. Note: You are responsible for ensuring that the ID is unique.  Maximum length: 127 characters

Members.Name: clientDetails
Members.Description: Information about the sender.

Members.Name: ipAddress
deviceId
applicationId
model
geoLocation
customerType
partnerName
customerId
fundingConstraint
Members.Description: Specifies a list of allowed funding types for the payment. This is a list of funding selections that can be combined in any order to allow payments to use the indicated funding type. If this Parameter is omitted, the payment can be funded by any funding type that is supported for Adaptive Payments. Note: FundingConstraint is unavailable to API callers with standard permission levels; for more information, refer to the section Adaptive Payments Permission Levels.

Members.Name: allowedFundingType
Members.Description: Specifies a list of allowed funding selections for the payment. This is a list of funding selections that can be combined in any order to allow payments to use the indicated funding type. If this field is omitted, the payment can be funded by any funding type that is supported for Adaptive Payments. Note: FundingConstraint is unavailable to API callers with standard permission levels; for more information, refer to the section Adaptive Payments Permission Levels.  Note: To use iACH, omit this field and do not specify a funding source for the payment.

Members.Name: fundingTypeInfo
Members.Description: Specifies a list of allowed funding selections for the payment. This is a list of funding selections that can be combined in any order to allow payments to use the indicated funding type. If this field is omitted, the payment can be funded by any funding type that is supported for Adaptive Payments. Note: FundingConstraint is unavailable to API callers with standard permission levels; for more information, refer to the section Adaptive Payments Permission Levels.

Members.Name: fundingType
Members.Description:
Specifies a list of allowed funding selections for the payment. This is a list of funding selections that can be combined in any order to allow payments to use the indicated funding type. If this field is omitted, the payment can be funded by any funding type that is supported for Adaptive Payments.

Allowable values are:
  • ECHECK - Electronic check
  • BALANCE - PayPal account balance
  • CREDITCARD - Credit card
Note: ECHECK and CREDITCARD include BALANCE implicitly. Note: FundingConstraint is unavailable to API callers with standard permission levels; for more information, refer to the section Adaptive Payments Permission Levels.

Members.Name: sender
Members.Description: Sender's identifying information.

Members.Name: email
Members.Description:
Sender's email address.

Maximum length: 127 characters

Members.Name: useCredentials
Members.Description: If true, use credentials to identify the sender; default is false.

Members.Name: phone
Members.Description: Sender's phone number.

Members.Name: countryCode
Members.Description: Telephone country code.

Members.Name: phoneNumber
Members.Description: Telephone number.

Members.Name: extension
Members.Description: Telephone extension.

Members.Name: taxIdDetails
Members.Description: Tax ID details (For Brazil only)

Members.Name: taxId
Members.Description: Tax id of the merchant/business.

Members.Name: taxIdType
Members.Description: Tax type of the Tax Id.

Parameters.Name: preapprovalDetailsRequest
Parameters.Description:
Retrieves information about an agreement (for making payments) 
						 between a sender and the API caller. In the request, specify the preapproval key of the agreement.

Members.Name: preapprovalKey
Members.Description: A preapproval key that identifies the preapproval for which you want to retrieve details. The preapproval key is returned in the PreapprovalResponse message.

Members.Name: requestEnvelope
Members.Description: Information common to each API operation, such as the language in which an error message is returned.

Members.Name: errorLanguage
Members.Description:
Contains the RFC 3066 identifier of the language in which error messages 
								are returned. The only supported option, and the default, is en_US (US English).

Members.Name: detailLevel
Members.Description:
The detail level is the amount of data to return in the call response.
								The default detail level is ReturnAll, which
								specifies that the call response 
								should contain the maximum data available.

Members.Name: getBillingAddress
Members.Description:
An option that lets you retrieve a list of billing addresses for the sender.
  • true - Includes the billing address in the response
  • false - Omits the billing address from the response (default)
Note: This field is available only to API callers with advanced permission levels. For information, refer to the section Adaptive Payments Permission Levels.

Parameters.Name: preapprovalRequest
Parameters.Description:
Sets up an agreement between a sender and the API caller. 
						The agreement provides for one or more payments to be made on the sender's behalf.
						Preapprovals are set up for a maximum amount, over a specific time period.
						Optionally, you can apply the following additional constraints: 
						the number of payments, a maximum per-payment amount, a specific day (of the week or month),
						and/or whether a PIN is required for each payment.

Members.Name: cancelUrl
Members.Description:
The URL to which the sender's browser is redirected after the sender cancels the preapproval at paypal.com.

Maximum length: 1024 characters

Members.Name: currencyCode
Members.Description:
The currency code. Allowable values are:
  • Australian Dollar - AUD
  • Brazilian Real - BRL Note: The Real is supported as a payment currency and currency balance only for Brazilian PayPal accounts.
  • Canadian Dollar - CAD
  • Czech Koruna - CZK
  • Danish Krone - DKK
  • EUR - Euro
  • Hong Kong Dollar - HKD
  • Hungarian Forint - HUF
  • Israeli New Sheqel - ILS
  • Japanese Yen - JPY
  • Malaysian Ringgit - MYR Note: The Ringgit is supported as a payment currency and currency balance only for Malaysian PayPal accounts.
  • Mexican Peso - MXN
  • Norwegian Krone - NOK
  • New Zealand Dollar - NZD
  • Philippine Peso - PHP
  • Polish Zloty - PLN
  • Pound Sterling - GBP
  • Singapore Dollar - SGD
  • Swedish Krona - SEK
  • Swiss Franc - CHF
  • Taiwan New Dollar - TWD
  • Thai Baht - THB
  • Turkish Lira - TRY Note: The Turkish Lira is supported as a payment currency and currency balance only for Turkish PayPal accounts.
  • U.S. Dollar - USD

Members.Name: returnUrl
Members.Description:
The URL to which the sender's browser is redirected after the sender approves the preapproval on paypal.com.

Maximum length: 1024 characters

Members.Name: startingDate
Members.Description: First date for which the preapproval is valid. It cannot be before today's date or after the ending date.

Members.Name: requestEnvelope
Members.Description: Information common to each API operation, such as the language in which an error message is returned.

Members.Name: errorLanguage
Members.Description:
Contains the RFC 3066 identifier of the language in which error messages 
								are returned. The only supported option, and the default, is en_US (US English).

Members.Name: detailLevel
Members.Description:
The detail level is the amount of data to return in the call response.
								The default detail level is ReturnAll, which
								specifies that the call response 
								should contain the maximum data available.

Members.Name: dateOfMonth
Members.Description: The day of the month on which a monthly payment is to be made. Allowable values are numbers between 0 and 31. A number between 1 and 31 indicates the date of the month. Specifying 0 indicates that payment can be made on any day of the month.

Members.Name: dayOfWeek
Members.Description:
The day of the week that a weekly payment is to be made.

Allowable values are:
  • NO_DAY_SPECIFIED
  • SUNDAY
  • MONDAY
  • TUESDAY
  • WEDNESDAY
  • THURSDAY
  • FRIDAY
  • SATURDAY

Members.Name: endingDate
Members.Description: Last date for which the preapproval is valid. It cannot be later than one year from the starting date.  Note:  You must specify a value unless you have specific permission from PayPal to omit this value.

Members.Name: maxAmountPerPayment
Members.Description: The preapproved maximum amount per payment. It cannot exceed the preapproved maximum total amount of all payments.

Members.Name: maxNumberOfPayments
Members.Description: The preapproved maximum number of payments. It cannot exceed the preapproved maximum total number of all payments.

Members.Name: maxNumberOfPaymentsPerPeriod
Members.Description: The preapproved maximum number of all payments per period. You must specify a value unless you have specific permission from PayPal.

Members.Name: maxTotalAmountOfAllPayments
Members.Description: The preapproved maximum total amount of all payments. It cannot exceed $2,000 USD or its equivalent in other currencies. Note:  You must specify a value unless you have specific permission from PayPal to omit this value.

Members.Name: paymentPeriod
Members.Description:
The payment period. It is one of the following values:
  • NO_PERIOD_SPECIFIED
  • DAILY - Each day
  • WEEKLY - Each week
  • BIWEEKLY - Every other week
  • SEMIMONTHLY - Twice a month
  • MONTHLY - Each month
  • ANNUALLY - Each year

Members.Name: memo
Members.Description:
A note about the preapproval.

Maximum length: 1000 characters, including newline characters

Members.Name: ipnNotificationUrl
Members.Description:
The URL to which you want all IPN messages for this preapproval to be sent. This URL supersedes the IPN notification URL in your profile.

Maximum length: 1024 characters

Members.Name: senderEmail
Members.Description:
Sender's email address. If not specified, the email address of the sender who logs in to approve the request becomes the email address associated with the preapproval key.

Maximum length: 127 characters

Members.Name: pinType
Members.Description:
Whether a personal identification number (PIN) is required. It is one of the following values:
  • NOT_REQUIRED - A PIN is not required (default)
  • REQUIRED - A PIN is required; the sender must specify a PIN when setting up the preapproval on PayPal

Members.Name: feesPayer
Members.Description:
The payer of PayPal fees. Allowable values are:
  • SENDER - Sender pays all fees (for personal, implicit simple/parallel payments; do not use for chained or unilateral payments)
  • PRIMARYRECEIVER - Primary receiver pays all fees (chained payments only)
  • EACHRECEIVER - Each receiver pays their own fee (default, personal and unilateral payments)
  • SECONDARYONLY - Secondary receivers pay all fees (use only for chained payments with one secondary receiver)

Members.Name: displayMaxTotalAmount
Members.Description:
Whether to display the maximum total amount of this preapproval. It is one of the following values:
  • TRUE - Display the amount
  • FALSE - Do not display the amount (default)

Members.Name: clientDetails
Members.Description: Information about the sender.

Members.Name: ipAddress
deviceId
applicationId
model
geoLocation
customerType
partnerName
customerId

Parameters.Name: refundRequest
Parameters.Description:
Refunds all or part of a payment, based on a pay key.
						The refund can include all payments covered by the pay key, 
						or the refund can include just an individual transaction
						(that is covered by a pay key). A refund also 
						can be based on a tracking ID, or on a
						specific receiver covered by the payKey.

  • Turkish Lira - TRY Note: The Turkish Lira is supported as a payment currency and currency balance only for Turkish PayPal accounts.
  • U.S. Dollar - USD

Members.Name: payKey
Members.Description: The key used to create the payment that you want to refund.

Members.Name: transactionId
Members.Description: The PayPal transaction ID associated with the payment that you want to refund.

Members.Name: trackingId
Members.Description: The tracking ID associated with the payment that you want to refund.

Members.Name: receiverList
Members.Description: Information about the receivers of the payment that you want to refund; the payment is identified by payment key, tracking ID, or transaction ID. Specify each receiver to whom you want to issue a refund. You can specify the refund amount for specific receivers. If you do not specify any receivers, all receivers will be fully refunded if you specify the payment key or tracking ID; otherwise, only the affected receiver will be fully refunded if you specify the transaction ID.

Members.Name: receiver
Members.Description: Receiver is the party whose account is credited.

Members.Name: amount
Members.Description: Amount to be paid to the receiver.

Members.Name: email
Members.Description:
Receiver's email address. This address can be unregistered with paypal.com. If so, a receiver cannot claim the payment until a PayPal account is linked to the email address. The PayRequest must pass either an email address or a phone number.

Maximum length: 127 characters

Members.Name: primary
Members.Description:
Whether this receiver is the primary receiver. If this field is set to true, this is a chained payment. If this field shows false, this is a simple or parallel payment.

Possible values are:
  • true - Primary receiver (chained payment)
  • false - Secondary receiver (simple/parallel payment)

Members.Name: invoiceId
Members.Description:
The invoice number for the payment. This data in this field shows on the Transaction Details report.

Maximum length: 127 characters

Members.Name: paymentType
Members.Description:
The transaction type for the payment.

Allowable values are:
  • GOODS - This is a payment for non-digital goods
  • SERVICE - This is a payment for services (default)
  • PERSONAL - This is a person-to-person payment
  • CASHADVANCE - This is a person-to-person payment for a cash advance
  • DIGITALGOODS - This is a payment for digital goods
    • BANK_MANAGED_WITHDRAWAL - This is a person-to-person payment for bank withdrawals, available only with special permission.
Note: Person-to-person payments are valid only for parallel payments that have the feesPayer field set to EACHRECEIVER or SENDER.

Members.Name: paymentSubType
Members.Description: The transaction subtype for the payment.

Members.Name: phone
Members.Description: The receiver's phone number.

Members.Name: countryCode
Members.Description: Telephone country code.

Members.Name: phoneNumber
Members.Description: Telephone number.

Members.Name: extension
Members.Description: Telephone extension.

Parameters.Name: setPaymentOptionsRequest
Parameters.Description:
Specifies settings for a payment.
						The settings apply to an actionType of CREATE in the Pay API call.

Members.Name: payKey
Members.Description: The pay key that identifies the payment for which you want to set payment options. This is the pay key returned in the PayResponse message.

Members.Name: requestEnvelope
Members.Description: Information common to each API operation, such as the language in which an error message is returned.

Members.Name: errorLanguage
Members.Description:
Contains the RFC 3066 identifier of the language in which error messages 
								are returned. The only supported option, and the default, is en_US (US English).

Members.Name: detailLevel
Members.Description:
The detail level is the amount of data to return in the call response.
								The default detail level is ReturnAll, which
								specifies that the call response 
								should contain the maximum data available.

Members.Name: shippingAddressId
Members.Description: Sender's shipping address ID.

Members.Name: initiatingEntity
Members.Description: The PayPal financial partner that is initiating the payment. Financial partners must first be set up in the Admin tool before they can use the PayPal APIs.

Members.Name: institutionCustomer
Members.Description: Details about the party that initiated this payment. This payment is made by the API caller on behalf of the initiating party. The initiating party can be an institution or a customer of the institution. The initiating party must be set up by PayPal Merchant Services.

Members.Name: institutionId
Members.Description:
The unique identifier as assigned to the
								institution.

Members.Name: firstName
Members.Description:
The first (given) name of the end
								consumer as known by the institution.

Members.Name: lastName
Members.Description:
The last (family) name of the end
								consumer as known by the institution.

Members.Name: displayName
Members.Description:
The full name of the end consumer as
								known by the institution.

Members.Name: institutionCustomerId
Members.Description:
The unique identifier as assigned to the
								end consumer by the institution.

Members.Name: countryCode
Members.Description:
The two-character ISO country code of
								the home country of the end consumer

Members.Name: email
displayOptions
Members.Description: Specifies display items in payment flows and emails.

Members.Name: emailHeaderImageUrl
Members.Description: The URL of the image that displays in the in the header of customer emails. The URL cannot exceed 1,024 characters. The image dimensions are 43 pixels high x 240 pixels wide.

Members.Name: emailMarketingImageUrl
Members.Description: The URL of the image that displays in the in customer emails. The URL cannot exceed 1,024 characters. The image dimensions are 80 pixels high x 530 pixels wide.

Members.Name: headerImageUrl
Members.Description: The URL of the image that displays in the header of a payment page. Use this to configure payment flows by passing a different image URL for different scenarios. If set, it overrides the header image URL specified in your account's Profile. The URL cannot exceed 1,024 characters. The image dimensions are 90 pixels high x 750 pixels wide. Note: The headerImageUrl and businessName parameters are mutually exclusive; only one of these fields can be used. If you specify both, the image will take precedence over the business name.

Members.Name: businessName
Members.Description: The business name to display. Note: The headerImageUrl and businessName parameters are mutually exclusive; only one of these fields can be used. If you specify both, the image will take precedence over the business name. The name cannot exceed 128 characters.[[GetPaymentOptionsResponse, SetPaymentsOptionsRequest]]

Members.Name: senderOptions
Members.Description: Specifies information to be provided by the sender.

Members.Name: requireShippingAddressSelection
Members.Description:
[WSDL] Require the user to select a shipping address during the web flow.

[DITA] If true, require the sender to select a shipping address during the embedded payment flow; default is false.

Members.Name: referrerCode
Members.Description:
A code that identifies the partner associated with this transaction.

Maximum length: 32 characters.

Members.Name: receiverOptions
Members.Description: Specifies information about each receiver.

Members.Name: receiver
Members.Description: Receiver ID associated with these options.

Members.Name: email
Members.Description:
Sender's email address.

Maximum length: 127 characters

Members.Name: phone
Members.Description: Sender's phone number.

Members.Name: countryCode
Members.Description: Telephone country code.

Members.Name: phoneNumber
Members.Description: Telephone number.

Members.Name: extension
Members.Description: Telephone extension.

Members.Name: description
Members.Description:
A description you want to associate with the payment. This overrides the value of the memo in Pay API for each receiver. If this is not specified the value in the memo will be used.

Maximum length: 1000 characters

Members.Name: customId
Members.Description:
An external reference or identifier you want to associate with the payment.

Maximum length: 1000 characters

Members.Name: referrerCode
invoiceData
Members.Description: Item information for the payment, which could appear on an invoice.

Members.Name: totalTax
Members.Description: Total tax associated with the payment.

Members.Name: totalShipping
Members.Description: Total shipping charge associated with the payment.

Members.Name: item
Members.Description: Any number of items associated with the payment.

Members.Name: name
Members.Description: Name of item.

Members.Name: identifier
Members.Description: External reference to item or item ID.

Members.Name: price
Members.Description: Price of item.

Members.Name: itemPrice
Members.Description: Price of an individual item.

Members.Name: itemCount
Members.Description: Item quantity.

Parameters.Name: getFundingPlansRequest
Parameters.Description:
Retrieves the funding plans available for a payment.
						The plans in the GetFundingPlans response 
						include considerations of the payment amount 
						and of the receiver's preferences and country.
						Specify a key to identify the payment for which you are retrieving funds. 
						This call only is supported for implicitly approved payments;  
						you must be both the payment sender and the API caller.

Members.Name: payKey
Members.Description: The key used to create the payment whose funding sources you want to determine.

Members.Name: requestEnvelope
Members.Description: Information common to each API operation, such as the language in which an error message is returned.

Members.Name: errorLanguage
Members.Description:
Contains the RFC 3066 identifier of the language in which error messages 
								are returned. The only supported option, and the default, is en_US (US English).

Members.Name: detailLevel
Members.Description:
The detail level is the amount of data to return in the call response.
								The default detail level is ReturnAll, which
								specifies that the call response 
								should contain the maximum data available.

Parameters.Name: getAvailableShippingAddressesRequest
Parameters.Description:
The request to get the addresses available for a
						payment.

Members.Name: key
Members.Description:
The key for which to provide the
								available addresses. Key can be an
								AdaptivePayments key such as payKey or
								preapprovalKey

Members.Name: requestEnvelope
errorLanguage
Members.Description:
Contains the RFC 3066 identifier of the language in which error messages 
								are returned. The only supported option, and the default, is en_US (US English).

Members.Name: detailLevel
Members.Description:
The detail level is the amount of data to return in the call response.
								The default detail level is ReturnAll, which
								specifies that the call response 
								should contain the maximum data available.

Parameters.Name: getShippingAddressesRequest
Parameters.Description:
Retrieves a shipping address, based the specified key. The key 
						identifies the account holder whose shipping address you want to obtain.
						Requires that a user has provided the address during the embedded 
						payment flow. 
						Note that the caller can be the primary payment receiver or 
						one of the parallel receivers.

Members.Name: key
Members.Description:
[WSDL] The key for which to provide the available addresses. Key can be an AdaptivePayments key such as payKey or preapprovalKey

[DITA] The payment paykey that identifies the account holder for whom you want to obtain the selected shipping address. Note: Shipping information can only be retrieved through the payment payKey; not through the preapprovalKey.

Members.Name: requestEnvelope
Members.Description: Information common to each API operation, such as the language in which an error message is returned.

Members.Name: errorLanguage
Members.Description:
Contains the RFC 3066 identifier of the language in which error messages 
								are returned. The only supported option, and the default, is en_US (US English).

Members.Name: detailLevel
Members.Description:
The detail level is the amount of data to return in the call response.
								The default detail level is ReturnAll, which
								specifies that the call response 
								should contain the maximum data available.

currencyCode
limitType
